channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Not going back: how Harris failed to turn the page on Trump in her 107-day sprint
item.description: Vice President Harris started her 107-day race buoyed by Democratic optimism, but came up short against former President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris started her 107-day race buoyed by Democratic optimism, but came up short against former President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialoski)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Trump won. Here are 3 Biden priorities under scrutiny
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to roll back some of President Biden's signature policies. Here's what Trump's victory means for Biden policies on climate, the civil service and Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to roll back some of President Biden's signature policies. Here's what Trump's victory means for Biden policies on climate, the civil service and Ukraine.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Australian breakdancer Raygun is retiring from the sport after her Olympics backlash
item.description: Raygun, whose real name is Rachael Gunn, said she had a hard time handling the criticism she received online about her performance. She said she will still dance leisurely.
item.content:encoded:
Raygun, whose real name is Rachael Gunn, said she had a hard time handling the criticism she received online about her performance. She said she will still dance leisurely.

(Image credit: Frank Franklin)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Howard University students disappointed but resilient after Harris' election loss
item.description: Vice President Harris has credited her alma mater Howard University for her achievements,
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris has credited her alma mater Howard University for her achievements,

(Image credit: Kyna Uwaeme for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: We checked up on the states that promise transparency on opioid settlement funds
item.description: Victims of the opioid crisis, health advocates, and policy experts have called on state and local governments to clearly report how they’re using the funds they are receiving from settlements with opioid companies.
item.content:encoded:
Victims of the opioid crisis, health advocates, and policy experts have called on state and local governments to clearly report how they’re using the funds they are receiving from settlements with opioid companies.

(Image credit: Andrew Lichtenstein)
item.dc:creator: Aneri Pattani

item.title: Australia proposes social media ban for children under the age of 16
item.description: If the legislation is passed, social media platforms including X, TikTok, Instagram and Facebook would have one year to work out how to exclude Australian children.
item.content:encoded:
If the legislation is passed, social media platforms including X, TikTok, Instagram and Facebook would have one year to work out how to exclude Australian children.

(Image credit: MICK TSIKAS)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Cuba's power grid goes down as Hurricane Rafael plows across island
item.description: The Category 3 storm knocked out the country's entire power grid just before making landfall, making it almost impossible for people to receive radio or television updates.
item.content:encoded:
The Category 3 storm knocked out the country's entire power grid just before making landfall, making it almost impossible for people to receive radio or television updates.

(Image credit: Ramon Espinosa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Canada orders TikTok's Canadian business to be dissolved but won't block app
item.description: Industry Minister François-Philippe Champagne said the decision to dissolve TikTok of its Canadian business is meant to address risks perceived to be related to TikTok's Chinese parent company.
item.content:encoded:
Industry Minister François-Philippe Champagne said the decision to dissolve TikTok of its Canadian business is meant to address risks perceived to be related to TikTok's Chinese parent company.

(Image credit: Matt Slocum)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Thousands in Southern California told to evacuate as wind-fed wildfire spreads
item.description: The Mountain Fire, northwest of Los Angeles, destroyed dozens of homes and forced thousands of residents to flee as forecasters warned of the potential for “extreme and life-threatening” blazes.
item.content:encoded:
The Mountain Fire, northwest of Los Angeles, destroyed dozens of homes and forced thousands of residents to flee as forecasters warned of the potential for “extreme and life-threatening” blazes.

(Image credit: Ethan Swope)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Amazon ordered to let workers vote on unionizing -- for the 3rd time
item.description: A federal administrative law judge says Amazon interfered in the last election on unionization at its warehouse in Bessemer, Ala.
item.content:encoded:
A federal administrative law judge says Amazon interfered in the last election on unionization at its warehouse in Bessemer, Ala.

(Image credit: Patrick Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh
